caption.text: Comparison between SREP and Blauzone Rheintal in strategic flood risk management planning.

cell.text: Initiated by regional authority, but plan making process follows a distinctive bottom-up approach, where local authorities define their development needs in coordination with the regional water authority.
Pronounced top-down approach with inter-sectoral coordination between spatial planning and water authorities at the regional level.
Non-formalized negotiation results are formalized in local land use planning.
Broad local participation and engagement by local authorities and stakeholders, such as blue light organizations, tourism organizations or farmer representatives
Broad information and consultation of municipalities and landowners minimized implementation problems
Zoning is based on negotiations; land mobilization is likely to occur subsequently.
Land mobilization is likely to occur as a consequence of a restrictive zoning category.

statement.text: In the given table they are not planning about the flood risk management how to avoid the risk or resolving the risk.
Plan Implementation will not gives the information to SREP as engagement by local authorities and stakeholders.
SREP and Blauzone Rheintal are same from each other in the given table.
There are 2 types of strategic one is SREP and another one isBlauzone Rheintal in the given table.
